page.title: 01Forge Valley Area
page.content: A varied block with a lot of natural deciduous woodland as well as some conifer planation. The Forge valley is a National Nature Reserve because it contains some of the rare ancient woodland and is little disturbed. Above this steep sided valley on east & east is a fairly flat area of intensive mainly arable farming, whilst the north, along the river valleys is more varied, with more woodland a smaller fields, so is more popular with visitors. Thorn Park drain acts as an overflow for the river Derwent. Primarily agricultural the block still has large areas given over to recreation-as well as Forge Valley, Raincliffe Woods are available for visitors use and are quite heavily used, being so close to Scarborough. It is a popular area for day trips because of the scenery,
